paramInformation.label: Set Dimmer Ramp Rate For Remote Control
Set Dimmer Ramp Rate For Local Control
Sets The Display Mode of The Leds
paramInformation.description: 0=normal mode (leds show load status) 1=status mode (custom LED status)

paramInformation.label: Sets The Normal Display Mode LED Color
Sets The Status Mode LED 1 (bottom) Color
Sets The Status Mode LED 2 Color
Sets The Status Mode LED 3 Color
Sets The Status Mode LED 4 Color
Sets The Status Mode LED 5 Color
Sets The Status Mode LED 6 Color
Sets The Status Mode LED 7 (top) Color
Led Light Mode
paramInformation.description: 0 = all LED on if load is off 1 = all LED off if load is off

paramInformation.label: Led Blink Frequency
paramInformation.description: Possible values: 0, 1-255 0=no blink, 1=100ms on then 100ms off

paramInformation.label: Enable LED Blink
paramInformation.description: Bitmask defines specific leds to enable for blinking: note: this decimal value is derived from a hex code calculation based on the following: bit 0 = LED 1, bit 1 = LED 2, bit 2 = LED 3, bit 3 = LED 4, bit 4 = LED 5, bit 5 = LED 6, bit 6 = LED 7 ie: value of 1 = first led, 64 = LED 7

paramInformation.label: No Neutral Mode
paramInformation.description: 0 = 3 wire mode (neutral, line, & load) 1 = 2 wire mode (line & load)

paramInformation.label: Invert Buttons
paramInformation.description: 0 = top of paddle turns load on 1 = bottom of paddle turns load on

paramInformation.label: Enables/Disables Central Scene And Multiple Tap Functions
paramInformation.description: 0 = central scene enabled, controls load with delay. enables multi-tap and press and hold 1 = central scene disabled, controls load instantly. disables multi-tap, central scene, press and hold

metadata.inclusion:
Follow this 2-step procedure to add (or remove) your new HomeSeer switch to (or from) your Z-Wave network:

1. Put your Z-Wave controller into inclusion (or exclusion) mode. Consult your controller’s manual if you’re unsure how to do this.
2. In rapid succession, tap the bottom paddle 2 times, then press & hold the bottom paddle for 3 seconds (tap-tap-press & hold). This will initiate the inclusion (or exclusion) process. Note: The switch will default to dimmer mode after Z-Wave exclusion
metadata.exclusion:
Follow this 2-step procedure to add (or remove) your new HomeSeer switch to (or from) your Z-Wave network:

1. Put your Z-Wave controller into inclusion (or exclusion) mode. Consult your controller’s manual if you’re unsure how to do this.
2. In rapid succession, tap the bottom paddle 2 times, then press & hold the bottom paddle for 3 seconds (tap-tap-press & hold). This will initiate the inclusion (or exclusion) process. Note: The switch will default to dimmer mode after Z-Wave exclusion
metadata.reset:
To be used only in the event that the network primary controller is lost or otherwise inoperable.

1. In rapid succession, tap the top paddle 3 times, then tap the bottom paddle 3 times. If all LEDs flash white 5 times, factory reset was successful. If not, repeat this procedure.
Note: As this must be done very quickly, we recommend using 2 fingers for this operation; one on each paddle!
Note: The switch will default to 3-wire mode and dimmer mode after factory reset
